document.heading: Closing of a Portion of a Public Alley in Square 5263; the Police Officers, Firefighters, and Teachers Retirement Amendments; the District of Columbia Depository Act of 1977 Amendments; and the District of Columbia Motor-Vehicle Fuel and Sales Tax Act and the District of Columbia Sales Tax Act Amendments of 1980 Act of 1980

history.narrative: Law 3-128, the “Closing of a Portion of a Public Alley in Square 5263; the Police Officers, Firefighters, and Teachers Retirement Amendments; the District of Columbia Depository Act of 1977 Amendments; and the District of Columbia Motor-Vehicle Fuel and Sales Tax Act and the District of Columbia Sales Tax Act Amendments of 1980 Act of 1980,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 3-394, which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Environmental Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 25, 1980 and December 9, 1980, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 7, 1981, it was assigned Act No. 3-337 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
